trans-unit.source: A factory for producing new (immutable) endpoint addresses with specific property values.

The new endpoint address can have its property values initialized from the property values of an existing endpoint address using the <xref:System.ServiceModel.EndpointAddressBuilder.%23ctor%28System.ServiceModel.EndpointAddress%29> constructor.

The endpoint addresses created can have their URI and identity values set using the <xref:System.ServiceModel.EndpointAddressBuilder.Uri%2A> and <xref:System.ServiceModel.EndpointAddressBuilder.Identity%2A> properties of the endpoint address builder.
Note that <xref:System.ServiceModel.EndpointAddress> is an immutable class.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.ServiceModel.EndpointAddressBuilder"></xref> class.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.ServiceModel.EndpointAddressBuilder"></xref> class from an existing endpoint address.
The values initialized for the endpoint builder from the endpoint address are the endpoint address itself and the identity, the headers, and the URI.
The <xref href="System.ServiceModel.EndpointAddress"></xref> whose property values are used to initialize the property values of this instance.
is `null`.
Returns the XML dictionary reader that contains the extensions of the endpoint address.
The reader provides access to the information that is not contained in the model of the endpoint reference defined by WS-Addressing.
The <xref href="System.Xml.XmlDictionaryReader"></xref> that reads the extensions of the endpoint address.
Returns the reader that contains the metadata associated with the endpoint address.
The <xref href="System.Xml.XmlDictionaryReader"></xref> that reads the metadata associated the endpoint address if there is some; otherwise, `null`.
Gets the list of address headers for the endpoints that the builder can create.
Address headers for the endpoints can be set using the <xref:System.ServiceModel.EndpointAddressBuilder.%23ctor%28System.ServiceModel.EndpointAddress%29> constructor.

The <xref href="System.Collections.Generic.List`1"></xref> of type <xref href="System.ServiceModel.Channels.AddressHeader"></xref> that contains the address headers for the endpoints that the builder can create.
Gets or sets the identity for the endpoints that the builder can create.
The identity is used by an endpoint to authenticate other endpoints when exchanging messages with them.
The <xref href="System.ServiceModel.EndpointIdentity"></xref> for the endpoint.
Specifies the XML dictionary reader that contains the extensions of the endpoint address.
The <xref href="System.Xml.XmlDictionaryReader"></xref> that reads the extensions of the endpoint.
Specifies the XML dictionary reader that contains the metadata associated with the endpoint address.
The <xref href="System.Xml.XmlDictionaryReader"></xref> that reads the metadata associated with the endpoint.
Creates a new endpoint address initialized with the property values of the current endpoint address builder.
The values initialized from the endpoint address are the identity, the address header collection, the URI, and the extension buffer.
The <xref href="System.ServiceModel.EndpointAddress"></xref> whose property are initialized with the values of the current endpoint address builder.
Gets or sets the URI for the endpoints that the builder can create.
Allows the programmer to set or get the URI associated with the endpoint address.
The <xref href="System.Uri"></xref> that specifies the endpoint address.
